statements.name: PROC SIMSYSTEM
statements.help:
PROC SIMSYSTEM <options>;                 
	MOMENTGRID  SKEWNESS=values KURTOSIS=values<MEAN=values STDDEV=values>;                 
	MOMENTS  SKEWNESS=values KURTOSIS=values<MEAN=values STDDEV=values>;                 
	OUTPUT  OUT=libref.data-table <keyword=name...keyword=name>;

arguments.name: CDF=
arguments.description: specifies values at which to compute the exact cumulative probability for each distribution

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: names the input data table for PROC SIMSYSTEM to use

arguments.name: MOMENTREPS
arguments.description: displays sample moments for individual samples when multiple replicates are computed by using the NREP= option

arguments.name: N=
arguments.description: specifies the number of simulated values to compute for each distribution

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: suppresses the normal display of results

arguments.name: NREP=
arguments.description: specifies the number of sample replicates to compute for each distribution

arguments.name: PDF=
arguments.description: specifies values at which to compute the exact probability density function for each distribution

arguments.name: QUANTILE=
arguments.description: specifies probability values at which to compute the exact quantiles for each distribution, where each of the specified values must be between 0 and 1, inclusive

arguments.name: PLOTS
arguments.description: controls the plots produced through ODS Graphics

arguments.name: ONLY
arguments.description: suppresses the default plots (global-plot-option)

arguments.name: UNPACKPANEL
arguments.description: suppresses paneling (global-plot-option)

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: produces all appropriate plots

arguments.name: HISTOGRAM
arguments.description: modifies the histograms of sampled values

arguments.name: MRMAP
arguments.description: modifies the moment-ratio map

arguments.name: MRMAP
arguments.description: modifies the moment-ratio map

arguments.name: MRMAP
arguments.description: modifies the moment-ratio map

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses all graphics

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: specifies an integer to use to start the pseudorandom number generator for drawing samples

arguments.name: SIMPLETOL=
arguments.description: specifies a tolerance value to use in choosing to map input skewness and kurtosis values to those of a simpler distribution

arguments.name: SYSTEM=
arguments.description: specifies the system to use to simulate data

statements.name: MOMENTGRID
statements.description: specifies a grid of combinations of skewness and kurtosis for the distributions that you want to sample

arguments.name: KURTOSIS=
arguments.description: specifies values of kurtosis

arguments.name: SKEWNESS=
arguments.description: specifies the skewness values

arguments.name: MEAN=
arguments.description: specifies the mean values

arguments.name: STDDEV=
arguments.description: specifies the standard deviation values

statements.name: MOMENTS
statements.description: specifies parallel lists of skewness and kurtosis for the distributions that you want to sample

arguments.name: KURTOSIS=
arguments.description: specifies values of kurtosis

arguments.name: SKEWNESS=
arguments.description: specifies values of skewness

arguments.name: MEAN=
arguments.description: specifies the mean values

arguments.name: STDDEV=
arguments.description: specifies values of the standard deviation, which must be positive

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: creates a new data table in which to save the values that are sampled from all specified distributions

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: names the output data table for PROC SIMSYSTEM to use

arguments.name: IOBS=
arguments.description: assigns a name to the variable that indexes the observation within a replicate of the distribution being sampled

arguments.name: KURT=
arguments.description: assigns a name to the variable that contains the kurtosis values

arguments.name: MEAN
arguments.description: adds the mean of the distribution being sampled to the output data table and optionally assigns a name to it

arguments.name: REPIDX=
arguments.description: assigns a name to the variable that indexes the replicate of the distribution being sampled

arguments.name: SIMIDX=
arguments.description: assigns a name to the variable that indexes the distribution being sampled

arguments.name: SIMVALUE=
arguments.description: assigns a name to the variable that contains the sampled values

arguments.name: SKEW=
arguments.description: assigns a name to the variable that contains the skewness values

arguments.name: STDDEV
arguments.description: adds the standard deviation of the distribution being sampled to the output data table and optionally assigns a name to it
